module.name: laz2_xpath
module.short: An implementation of the XML Path Language (XPath) for Free Pascal

descr.p: laz2_xpath.pas provides an implementation of the XML Path Language (XPath) for Free Pascal. It is based on the xpath.pp unit from the Free Component Library (FCL).
Copyright (c) 2000 - 2003 by Areca Systems GmbH / Sebastian Guenther, sg@freepascal.org
This implementation is based on the following specification:

p.url: XML Path Language (XPath) Version 1.0 W3C Recommendation 16 November 1999

element.name: TXPathToken
element.short: Identifies token types used in XPath expressions

element.name: TXPathToken.tkInvalid
element.short: Token is not a valid XPath expression

element.name: TXPathToken.tkEndOfStream
element.short: End of the XPath data stream

element.name: TXPathToken.tkDot
element.short: Token contains a the current node (.) expression

element.name: TXPathToken.tkDotDot
element.short: Token contains the parent node (..) expression

element.name: TXPathToken.tkPipe
element.short: Token contains the operator | expression character

element.name: TXPathKeyword
element.short: Represents keywords used in XPath syntax
element.descr: TXPathKeyword is an enumeration type that represents the axis names, node tests, operators, and standard functions available in XPath syntax.

element.name: TXPathKeyword.xkProcessingInstruction
element.short: Node test for preceding instruction: processing-instruction()

element.name: TXPathKeyword.xkNode
element.short: Node test for a node: node()

element.name: TXPathExprNode
element.short: Defines the base class used to evaluate XPath expressions

descr.p: TXPathExprNode is a class used to evaluate an XPath expression. XPath expressions are evaluated relative to a context node, and the XPath environment. The XPath environment may contain variable bindings, the XPath core functions, and other functions loaded from other namespaces.

TXPathExprNode provides the abstract Evaluate method which is used to perform XPath expression evaluation. It must be re-implemented in descendent classes which provide support for specific expression types that can occur in XPath syntax.

EvalPredicate is a Boolean function used to evaluate an XPath Predicate Expression. EvalPredicate calls the Evaluate method using the specified Content node and Environment. An Expression that evaluates to a numeric value is considered to be True when the result matches the ContextPosition in the AContext argument.
EvalPredicate is used in the implementation of other specialized Predicate Expressions types descended from TXPathExprNode.

element.name: TXPathExprNode.EvalPredicate.Result
element.short: Boolean result for the evaluated expression

element.name: TXPathExprNode.Evaluate
element.short: Specifies the method used to evaluate an XPath Predicate Expression

descr.p: Evaluate is an abstract virtual TXPathVariable function which specifies the interface used to evaluate an XPath Predicate Expression. Evaluate must be implemented in descendent classes which handles specific Predicate Expression types in the XPath syntax.

element.name: TXPathExprNode.Evaluate.Result
element.short: Contains the result for the evaluated expression

element.name: TXPathNodeArray
element.short: Array used to store TXPathExprNode entries

descr.p: TXPathNodeArray is an array of TXPathExprNode type. It is used to store XPath predicate expressions passed as arguments to TXPathExprNode descendants or TXPathScanner.

TXPathConstantNode is a TXPathExprNode descendant that represents an XPath predicate expression which contains a Literal value (any value surrounded by Quotation Marks). The return value is the TXPathVariable passed to the constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TXPathConstantNode.Create.AValue
element.short: XPath variable with the value for the literal expression

element.name: TXPathConstantNode.Evaluate
element.short: Evaluates the XPath expression using the context node and environment

descr.p: TXPathVariableNode is a TXPathExprNode descendant that represents an XPath Variable Reference expression in the XPath syntax. For example:
TXPathVariableNode provides an overridden Evaluate method that is used to get the value for the node from the variable bindings in the XPath environment.
Evaluate is an overridden method used to evaluate the XPath expression and return its derived value. Evaluate implements the abstract method defined in the ancestor class.

For TXPathVariableNode, Evaluate uses the XPath environment passed in the AEnvironment argument to retrieve the value for the variable. If a variable is not found with the required name in the XPath environment, the EvaluationError method is called to raise an exception with the message in lrsEvalUnknownVariable.

errors.p: Raises an exception (in EvaluationError) when the variable name does not exist in the XPath environment. Raised with the exception message in lrsEvalUnknownVariable.

descr.p: TXPathFunctionNode is a TXPathExprNode descendant that represents a Function Name expression in the XPath syntax. For example:

TXPathFunctionNode provides an overridden Evaluate method which is used to access the named function in the XPath environment with the arguments found in the expression. TXPathFunctionNode provides private members that are used to store the name for the function and its optional arguments.

Evaluate is an overridden TXPathVariable function that implements the method defined in the ancestor class. Evaluate is used to derive the value for the function call using any arguments found in the XPath expression, and to store the result in the TXPathVariable return value.

Evaluate uses the AEnvironment parameter to access the function names (and their implementations) available in the XPath environment. If a function with the required name is not found in AEnvironment, the EvaluationError routine is called to raise an exception with the message in lrsEvalUnknownFunction.

Evaluate creates an internal TXPathVarList instance that is used to store the value for any arguments in the XPath expression. The list, and the context node in AContext, are passed to the function call. The internal list is freed prior to exiting from the method.
TXPathNegationNode is a TXPathExprNode descendant used to represent a Unary Expression with a Negation literal in the XPath syntax. For example:
TXPathNegationNode provides an overridden Evaluate method used to derive the return value for the expression.
Evaluate is an overridden TXPathVariable function used to get the derived value for the XPath expression. Evaluate implements the abstract method defined in the ancestor class.
Evaluate uses the value in the AContext and AEnvironment parameters to calculate the numeric value for the expression.

element.name: TXPathBinaryNode
element.short: The base class for Binary Operations

element.name: TXPathMathOp
element.short: Identifies Math Operators used in XPath expressions

element.name: TXPathMathOpNode
element.short: Represents a Math Operation in an XPath expression

descr.p: TXPathMathOpNode is a TXPathBinaryNode descendant used to represent a math operation in an XPath expression. TXPathMathOpNode is used for the Additive and Multiplicative Expressions defined in the XPath specification. The constructor accepts the operator and the operands from the expression. TXPathMathOpNode provides an overridden Evaluate method used to derive the value for the XPath expression.

element.name: TXPathMathOpNode.Create.AOperator
element.short: Math operator used in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathCompareOp
element.short: Identifies a Comparison operator used in an XPath expression

element.name: TXPathCompareOp.opLessEqual
element.short: The Less Than Or Equal (<=) operator

element.name: TXPathCompareOp.opGreaterEqual
element.short: The Greater Than Or Equal (>=) operator

descr.p: TXPathCompareNode is a TXPathBinaryNode descendant used to represent Equality or Relational expressions in the XPath syntax.

TXPathCompareNode contains an overridden constructor used to specify the operator and operands for the comparison expression. TXPathCompareNode provides an overridden Evaluate method which compares the nodes or node sets for the XPath expression.

element.name: TXPathBooleanOp
element.short: Represents Boolean operators in an XPath expression

element.name: TXPathBooleanOpNode
element.short: Represents a Boolean expression in XPath syntax

descr.p: TXPathBooleanOpNode is a TXPathBinaryNode descendant used to represent an And or Or expression in XPath syntax. TXPathBooleanOpNode provides an overridden constructor that specifies the operator and operands for the XPath expression. TXPathBooleanOpNode contains an overridden Evaluate method which performs the comparison using Boolean short-circuit logic; i. e. the second operand is ignored if the result can be determined using the first operand.
TXPathUnionNode is a TXPathBinaryNode descendant used to represent a Union expression in the XPath syntax. For example:

TXPathUnionNode provides a constructor used to set the operands for the Union expression. An overridden Evaluate method is provided to evaluate node sets generated for the XPath expression. It ensures that the selected node sets for each operand are in document order.
TNodeSet is a class alias used to implement a Node Set as defined in the XPath specification. TNodeSet is an alias for the TFPList class.
TXPathFilterNode is a TXPathExprNode descendant used to implement a Filter expression in the XPath syntax. For example:

TXPathFilterNode allows a node set to be filtered to ensure that only values matching the XPath expression are included in the result. An overridden Evaluate method is provided to generate the node set in the return value, and to apply predicates in the XPath expression.

element.name: TXPathFilterNode.ApplyPredicates
element.short: Applies Predicates to the XPath Node Set

element.name: TXPathFilterNode.ApplyPredicates.Nodes
element.short: Node Set used as the context nodes for predicate expressions

element.name: TXPathFilterNode.Create.AExpr
element.short: XPath Expression to use in the class instance

element.name: TAxis
element.short: Identifies an XPath Axis used in an XPath expression

element.name: TAxis.axisInvalid
element.short: An invalid Axis name in the XPath syntax

element.name: TNodeTestType.ntAnyPrincipal
element.short: The Any Principal Node Test type

element.name: TNodeTestType.ntPINode
element.short: The Processing Instruction Node Test type

descr.p: TStep is a TXPathFilterNode descendant used to implement a Location Step expression in the XPath syntax. A location step expression contains an Axis name, a node test, and optional predicates that determine the items available in a node set. For example:
Use the constructor to specify the Axis and Node Test for the XPath expression. An overridden Evaluate method is provided to select the nodes included in the node set returned by the method.

element.name: TStep.SelectNodes
element.short: Builds the Node Set for the XPath Location Step

element.name: TStep.SelectNodes.ANode
element.short: Context node for the Location Step

element.name: TStep.SelectNodes.ResultNodes
element.short: Node Set for the evaluated expression

element.name: TStep.Axis
element.short: Axis type for the Location Step

element.name: TStep.NodeTestType
element.short: Node Test Type for the Location Step

element.name: TStep.NodeTestString
element.short: Node Test Type as a String value

element.name: TStep.NSTestString
element.short: Namespace Test as a String value

element.name: TStep.Create.aAxis
element.short: Axis type to use for the Location Step

element.name: TStep.Create.aTest
element.short: Node Test Type to use for the Location Step

element.name: TStep.Evaluate
element.short: Evaluates the XPath expression for the Location Step

element.name: EXPathEvaluationError
element.short: Exception raised when an error occurs during XPath expression evaluation

element.name: EvaluationError
element.short: Raises an exception during expression evaluation with the specified error message

element.name: EvaluationError.Args
element.short: Arguments used to format the message for the evaluation error

element.name: TXPathVariable
element.short: Base class used to represent an XPath variables and results

descr.p: TXPathVariable is a class used to represent Variables and Results for an XPath expression. TXPathVariable is a base class, and contains abstract methods which must be implemented in descendent classes for the Node Set, String, Number, and Boolean data types allowed in XPath variables and results.
TXPathVariable is used as the return type for the Evaluate method in TXPathExprNode and descendent classes. It is also used as the return value for Functions implemented in TXPathEnvironment.

element.name: TXPathVariable.Error
element.short: Raises an exception with the specified message and arguments

element.name: TXPathVariable.Error.Args
element.short: Arguments used to format the message for the error

element.name: TXPathVariable.TypeName
element.short: Gets the Type name for the XPath variable class instance

element.name: TXPathVariable.Release
element.short: Decrements the reference count for the variable

element.name: TXPathVariable.AsNodeSet
element.short: Gets the XPath variable as a node set

element.name: TXPathVariable.AsNodeSet.Result
element.short: Value for the variable as a Node Set

element.name: TXPathVariable.AsBoolean
element.short: Gets the XPath variable as a Boolean value

element.name: TXPathVariable.AsBoolean.Result
element.short: Value for the variable as a Boolean data type

element.name: TXPathVariable.AsNumber
element.short: Gets the XPath variable as a Numeric value

element.name: TXPathVariable.AsNumber.Result
element.short: Value for the variable as a Numeric data type

element.name: TXPathVariable.AsText
element.short: Gets the XPath variable as a String value

element.name: TXPathVariable.AsText.Result
element.short: Value for the variable as a String data type

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable
element.short: Represents an XPath Node Set variable

descr.p: TXPathNodeSetVariable is a TXPathVariable used to represent a Node Set variable. TXPathNodeSetVariable implements the abstract methods defined in the ancestor class, and contains an internal TNodeSet member used to store the nodes in the node set.
Use the Value property to access the XPath variable as a TNodeSet class instance. Use AsText, AsNumber, or AsBoolean to access the value for the variable using the corresponding data type.

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.Create.AValue
element.short: Value for the Node Set variable

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.TypeName
element.short: Gets the Type Name for the variable class

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.TypeName.Result
element.short: Value for the Node Type name

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.AsNodeSet
element.short: Gets the Node Set in its native format

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.AsNodeSet.Result
element.short: Value for the Node Set variable as a Node Set type

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.AsText
element.short: Gets the Node Set as a String value

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.AsText.Result
element.short: Value for the Node Set variable as a String data type

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.AsBoolean
element.short: Gets the Node Set as a Boolean value
element.descr: The return value is True when the Count property for the mode set is not 0.

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.AsBoolean.Result
element.short: Value for the Node Set variable as a Boolean data type

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.AsNumber
element.short: Gets the Node Set as a Numeric value

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.AsNumber.Result
element.short: Value for the Node Set variable as a Numeric data type

element.name: TXPathNodeSetVariable.Value
element.short: Value for the Node Set variable

element.name: TXPathBooleanVariable.AsBoolean
element.short: Gets the value for the Boolean variable as a Boolean data type

element.name: TXPathBooleanVariable.AsNumber
element.short: Gets the value for the Boolean variable as a Numeric data type

element.name: TXPathBooleanVariable.AsText
element.short: Gets the value for the Boolean variable as a String data type

element.name: TXPathNumberVariable.AsBoolean
element.short: Gets the value for the Numeric variable as a Boolean data type

element.name: TXPathNumberVariable.AsNumber
element.short: Gets the value for the Numeric variable as a Numeric data type

element.name: TXPathNumberVariable.AsText
element.short: Gets the value for the Numeric variable as a String data type

element.name: TXPathStringVariable.TypeName
element.short: Gets the Type Name for the variable

element.name: TXPathStringVariable.AsBoolean
element.short: Gets the value for the variable as a Boolean data type

element.name: TXPathStringVariable.AsNumber
element.short: Gets the value for the variable as a Numeric data type

element.name: TXPathStringVariable.AsText
element.short: Gets the value for the variable as a String data type

element.name: TXPathNSResolver
element.short: Implements a Namespace resolver for the XPath environment

descr.p: TXPathNSResolver is a class used to implement a Namespace resolver for the XPath environment. TXPathNSResolver performs namespace lookups for Qualified Names which include a prefix. Namespaces are resolved relative to the context node passed to the constructor for the class instance.
TXPathNSResolver is used in the implementation of TXPathScanner, TXPathExpression, and passed as an argument to the EvaluateXPathExpression routine.

element.name: TXPathNSResolver.Create.aNode
element.short: Context node for the Namespace Resolver

element.name: TXPathNSResolver.LookupNamespaceURI
element.short: Gets the Namespace URI with the specified Prefix
element.descr: Namespace prefixes and URI are resolved relative to the context node for the resolver.

element.name: TXPathNSResolver.LookupNamespaceURI.Result
element.short: Namespace URI for the specified Prefix

element.name: TXPathNSResolver.LookupNamespaceURI.aPrefix
element.short: Prefix to locate in the Namespace information for the Context node

element.name: TXPathScanner
element.short: Implements a lexical scanner and parser using XPath syntax and semantics

descr.p: TXPathScanner is a class which implements a lexical scanner/parser using the syntax and semantics defined in XPath (XML Path Language). TXPathScanner provides methods used to tokenize and parse the XPath Expression types defined in the specification, at:

p.url: XML Path Language (XPath) Version 1.0 W3C Recommendation 16 November 1999

descr.p: TXPathScanner examines an XPath expression, and creates a parse tree representing the lexical and syntactic elements found in the expression. The parse tree consists of TXPathExprNode (and descendent) class instances which evaluate the XPath expressions and generate the result(s).
TXPathScanner is used in the implementation of the TXPathExpression class.

element.name: TXPathScanner.Error
element.short: Raises an exception with the specified message

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParsePredicates.Dest
element.short: Destination nodes for XPath predicates in the expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseStep
element.short: Parses XPath Location Steps in the expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseStep.Result
element.short: TStep class instance for the Location Step

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseNodeTest
element.short: Parses XPath Node Tests to determine the principal node type for the expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseNodeTest.Result
element.short: TStep class instance for the Location Step

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseNodeTest.axis
element.short: Axis to use for the Location Step in the result value

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParsePrimaryExpr
element.short: Parses a Primary Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParsePrimaryExpr.Result
element.short: Primary expression parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseFunctionCall
element.short: Parses a FunctionCall Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseFunctionCall.Result
element.short: Function call parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseUnionExpr
element.short: Parses a Union Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseUnionExpr.Result
element.short: Union expression parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParsePathExpr
element.short: Parses a Path Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParsePathExpr.Result
element.short: Path expression parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseFilterExpr
element.short: Parses a Filter Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseFilterExpr.Result
element.short: Filter expression parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseOrExpr
element.short: Parses an Or Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseOrExpr.Result
element.short: Or expression parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseAndExpr
element.short: Parses an And Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseAndExpr.Result
element.short: And expression parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseEqualityExpr
element.short: Parses an Equality Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseEqualityExpr.Result
element.short: Equality expression parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseRelationalExpr
element.short: Parses a Relational Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseRelationalExpr.Result
element.short: Relational expression parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseAdditiveExpr
element.short: Parses an Additive Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseAdditiveExpr.Result
element.short: Additive expression parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseMultiplicativeExpr
element.short: Parses a Multiplicative Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseMultiplicativeExpr.Result
element.short: Multiplicative expression parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseUnaryExpr
element.short: Parses an Unary Expression in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.ParseUnaryExpr.Result
element.short: Unary expression parsed in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.GetToken
element.short: Gets a lexical token in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.GetToken.Result
element.short: Lexical token read in the scanner

element.name: TXPathScanner.ScanQName
element.short: Locates a Qualified Name in a token

element.name: TXPathScanner.ScanQName.Result
element.short: False if the token does not contain a valid QName

element.name: TXPathScanner.Create.AExpressionString
element.short: XPath expression examined in the scanner/parser

element.name: TXPathScanner.NextToken
element.short: Gets the next token in the XPath expression

element.name: TXPathScanner.NextToken.Result
element.short: Token kind located in the method

element.name: TXPathScanner.PeekToken
element.short: Peeks at the token kind for the next lexical element

element.name: TXPathScanner.PeekToken.Result
element.short: Value for the pending logical token in the scanner

element.name: TXPathScanner.SkipToken
element.short: Skips the current token when it is not an error

element.name: TXPathScanner.SkipToken.Result
element.short: True if the current token is the same as the tok argument

element.name: TXPathScanner.CurToken
element.short: Current token kind in the lexical analysis

element.name: TXPathScanner.CurTokenString
element.short: Current token value in the lexical analysis

element.name: TXPathContext
element.short: Represents the Context for an XPath expression

element.name: TXPathContext.ContextNode
element.short: The node for the XPath context

element.name: TXPathContext.ContextPosition
element.short: The position in the context node

element.name: TXPathContext.ContextSize
element.short: The size (or length) of the context node set

element.name: TXPathContext.Create.AContextSize
element.short: Size (or length) of the context node set

element.name: TXPathVarList
element.short: List used to store XPath variables in the XPath environment

element.name: TXPathFunction.Result
element.short: XPath variable returned from the XPath function implementation

element.name: TXPathEnvironment
element.short: Provides access to functions and variables available in the XPath environment

descr.p: TXPathEnvironment is a class which provides access to the core function library and variable bindings available for use in an XPath context. TXPathEnvironment is not an interface that is directly mandated in the XPath specification, but the functionality it provides is required for any XPath Context node.

TXPathEnvironment provides methods used to add or remove Functions or Variables in the XPath environment. Properties are provided to access Functions and Variables by their name or their ordinal position. The Functions property is pre-populated with the Core Function Library described in the XPath specification.

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetFunctionCount
element.short: Gets the value for the FunctionCount property

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetVariableCount
element.short: Gets the value for the VariableCount property

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetFunction
element.short: Gets the Function with the specified Name or ordinal position

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetFunction.Result
element.short: XPath function with the specified name or ordinal position

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetFunction.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested function

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetVariable
element.short: Gets the variable with the specified name or ordinal position

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetVariable.Result
element.short: XPath variable with the specified name or ordinal position

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetVariable.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested variable

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.xpLast

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.xpRound
element.short: Implements the round() function from the XPath Core Function Library

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.xpRound.Result
element.short: Variable returned by the XPath function

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetFunctionIndex
element.short: Gets the ordinal position of the XPath function with the specified name

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetFunctionIndex.Result
element.short: Ordinal position of the XPath function with the specified name

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetFunctionIndex.AName
element.short: Name of the XPath function to locate in the Functions property

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetVariableIndex
element.short: Gets the ordinal position of the variable with the specified name

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetVariableIndex.Result
element.short: Ordinal position of the variable with the specified name

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.GetVariableIndex.AName
element.short: Name of the variable to locate in the Variables property

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.AddFunction
element.short: Adds a function to the Functions property with the specified name

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.AddFunction.AName
element.short: Name for the function added to the Functions property

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.AddFunction.AFunction
element.short: Function implementation to use for the specified function name

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.AddVariable
element.short: Adds a variable with the given name and value to the Variables property

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.AddVariable.AName
element.short: Name of the variable added in the method

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.AddVariable.AVariable
element.short: Value for the variable added in the method

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.RemoveFunction
element.short: Removes a function with the specified name or ordinal position from the Functions property

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.RemoveFunction.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the Function with the specified name

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.RemoveFunction.AName
element.short: Name of the function to remove from the Functions property

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.RemoveVariable
element.short: Removes a variable with the specified name or ordinal position

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.RemoveVariable.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the variable to remove from the XPath environment

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.RemoveVariable.AName
element.short: Name of the variable to remove from the XPath environment

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.FunctionCount
element.short: Indicates the number of XPath functions in the XPath environment

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.VariableCount
element.short: Indicates the number of variables defined in the XPath environment

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.Functions
element.short: Provides indexed access to XPath functions in the environment

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.Functions.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested XPath function

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.FunctionsByName
element.short: Gets an XPath function with the specified name

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.FunctionsByName.AName
element.short: Name for the requested XPath function

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.Variables
element.short: Provides indexed access to XPath variables in the XPath environment

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.Variables.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested variable

element.name: TXPathEnvironment.VariablesByName
element.short: Gets an XPath variable with the specified name

element.name: TXPathExpression
element.short: Evaluates an XPath expression using the specified scanner and resolver

element.name: TXPathExpression.Create.AScanner
element.short: Lexical scanner/parser used to evaluate the expression

element.name: TXPathExpression.Create.CompleteExpression
element.short: The XPath expression evaluated in the class instance

element.name: TXPathExpression.Create.AResolver
element.short: Namespace resolver used to evaluate the expression

element.name: TXPathExpression.Evaluate
element.short: Evaluates an XPath expression using the specified context node and environment

element.name: EvaluateXPathExpression
element.short: Evaluates an XPath expression using the specified context node and resolver

element.name: EvaluateXPathExpression.Result
element.short: XPath variable representing the evaluated XPath expression

element.name: EvaluateXPathExpression.AExpressionString
element.short: XPath expression evaluated in the routine

element.name: EvaluateXPathExpression.AContextNode
element.short: Context node for the XPath expression
